itec.minicompiler.SymbolTable
Class SymbolTable

java.lang.Object
  itec.minicompiler.SymbolTable.SymbolTable
public class SymbolTable
extends java.lang.Object

The SymbolTable implements a linked list of Symbols the Parser uses to maintain the structure of the Symbols given by the source code and to do the scoping. Each Symbol in the SymbolTable has a pointer to the next Symbol in its scope (if any) and can have a pointer to a subscope (if needed). The beginning of the SymbolTable is the universeScope where the predefined constants, types and procedures of the language should be inserted.

Version:
1.0 (29.09.2004)
Author:
Stefan Leitner, Stefan Schauer

The actualSymbol of the SymbolTable

openScope

public void openScope()
Open a new scope in the SymbolTable. The actual scope of the new scope is the actualSymbol. As first element in the new scope a HEAD-Symbol is inserted. The name of this HEAD-Symbol indicates the type of the new scope. It can be universe_scope, module_scope, procedure_scope or record_scope.

closeScope

public void closeScope()
Close the actual scope.

putSymbol

public void putSymbol(Symbol sym)
Insert a Symbol sym in the actual scope.

Parameters:
sym - The Symbol which should be inserted

getSymbol

public Symbol getSymbol(Symbol sym)
Search for the Symbol sym in the SymbolTable. The search is restricted onto the universe scope, the module scope and the actual scope.

Parameters:
sym - The Symbol which should be found
Returns:
The Symbol itself, if it's found in the SymbolTable, null otherwise

isPresent

public boolean isPresent(Symbol sym)
Check if the Symbol sym is already present in the actual scope or in the universe scope.

Parameters:
sym - The Symbol which should be checked
Returns:
True, if the Symbol is already present, False otherwise

Check if the Symbol sym is a reserved word (i.e. if sym is present in the universe-scope

Returns:
True, if the Symbol is present in the universe-scope, False otherwise
